[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Repository System (RS) defines requirements for managing collections, permissions, and metadata.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: RS supports ingest, embargoes, replication, and reporting.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: RS integrates with Fedora, Symplectic Elements, and Linked Data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: RS provides dashboards for curators, admins, and contributors.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: RS operates on cloud and on-premises infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: RS supports APIs for metadata updates and permissions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: RS optimizes storage for large datasets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: RS links to external repositories and metadata harvesters.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: RS handles ingest, permissions, embargoes, metadata, and reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: RS serves curators, admins, researchers, and contributors.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: RS depends on network stability and metadata standards.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: RS integrates with external systems and standards.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: OAI-PMH: Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with Fedora for metadata and object management (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall expose metadata through OAI-PMH.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall provide APIs for batch ingest and metadata retrieval (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enforce embargo policies, updating permissions upon expiration (REQ-DSGN-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall provide tools for batch ingest, audit logs, and reporting (REQ-INTF-003).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall enable repository data replication.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive dashboard for managing repository collections (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process metadata updates within 5 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 5,000 concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store repository metadata with versioning (REQ-FUNC-003).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall manage object lifecycle states.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with GDPR and repository policies (REQ-COMP-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO 16363 for digital repositories and ISO 27001 for security.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall enforce role-based access control.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall maintain 99.9% uptime with failover mechanisms.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Testing batch ingest, embargo enforcement, replication, and metadata exposure.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Repository architecture, metadata standards, and API specifications.
[SEC] 5. References: GDPR, Fedora documentation, OAI-PMH standards, ISO 16363, and ISO 27001.
